page.title: 18BMX Bicycles in S.on A.
page.content: Recreation. BMX bicycles are designed for cross country racing or for freestyle stunt riding.The bikes which most children ride can do both.They have a very strong frame, studded tyres and padding on all sharp edges. The riders wear padding on their knees and elbows,a suit of tough material, gloves and a safety helmet complete with visor and dust mask.Many boys and some girls have a BMX bike and use it as an ordinary bicycle as well as for rough use.The bikes can be ridden anywhere but should not be used on the pavement.Stratford has its own BMX track.It is on the Warwick Road behind the Leisure Centre.As you go down from the starter gate you come to a speed ramp then you go round a burn,over a pyramid ramp,round another burn,then over the whoops.It is easy to fall and you will need the padding!
